concept.title: Language-dependent number formats
concept.shortdesc: Separators for decimals and thousands are dependent on the language of Windows, but can be changed in Excel.

conbody.p: The way Excel is formatting numbers depends of the language version of Windows. Especially for the decimal and thousands separators this may cause confusion and problems. By default, Windows uses the following characters.

ul.li:
Dutch
Decimal separator comma: 12,34
Thousands separator point: 12.345

English
Decimal separator point: 12.34
Thousands separator comma: 12,345

conbody.p: When you want to change these settings permanently, it must be done through the regional settings in the control panel of Windows.
Fortunately, you can temporarily change these settings in Excel. To do this, follow these steps.

ol.li: Under Editing options clear the check box Use system separators.
Type new separators in the Decimal separator and Thousands separator boxes.

conbody.note: When you want to use the system separators again, select the Use system separators check box.
